arabicText: فَأَرَادَ أَن يَسْتَفِزَّهُم مِّنَ ٱلْأَرْضِ فَأَغْرَقْنَـٰهُ وَمَن مَّعَهُۥ جَمِيعًۭا
englishTranslationText:
He	therefore	wished	to	expel	them	from	the	earth,	so	We	drowned	him	and	his	companions,	all	
together.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	us	ne	chāha	ke	un	ko	zameen	se	nikāl	de	to	ham	ne	use	aur	us	ke	sāthiyoñ	sab	ko	dubo	diya

arabicText: وَقُلْنَا مِنۢ بَعْدِهِۦ لِبَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ ٱسْكُنُوا۟ ٱلْأَرْضَ فَإِذَا جَآءَ وَعْدُ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ جِئْنَا بِكُمْ لَفِيفًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	 after	 him,	 We	 said	 to	 the	 Descendants	 of	 Israel,	 “Reside	 in	 this	 land	 - then	 when	 the	
promise	of	the	Hereafter	comes,	We	will	bring	you	all	huddled	together.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur is	ke	b’ad	ham	ne	bani	Israel	se	 farmāya	us	zameen	meiñ	baso	phir	jab	āakhirat	ka	w’ada		
āayega	ham	tum	sab	ko	ghālmel	le	āayeñge

arabicText: وَبِٱلْحَقِّ أَنزَلْنَـٰهُ وَبِٱلْحَقِّ نَزَلَ ۗ وَمَآ أَرْسَلْنَـٰكَ إِلَّا مُبَشِّرًۭا وَنَذِيرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	 We	 sent	 down	 the	 Qur’an	 with	 the	
truth,	 and	 it	 has	 come	 down	 only	 for	 the	
truth;	and	We	did	not	send	you	except	as	a	
Herald	of	glad	tidings	and	warnings.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Ham	ne	Qurān	ko	Haq	hi	ke	sāth	utāra	
aur	haq	hi	ke	sāth	utra	aur	ham	ne	 tumheñ	
na	bheja	magar	khushi	aur	dar	sunāta

arabicText: وَقُرْءَانًۭا فَرَقْنَـٰهُ لِتَقْرَأَهُۥ عَلَى ٱلنَّاسِ عَلَىٰ مُكْثٍۢ وَنَزَّلْنَـٰهُ تَنزِيلًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	We	sent	down	the	Qur’an	in	parts,	that	you	
may	 gradually	 recite	it	 to	 the	 people,	 and	We	
sent	it	down	slowly	in	stages.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	qurān	ham	ne	juda	juda	kar	ke	utāra	ke	
tum	usey	logoñ	par	thaher	thaher	kar	padho	
aur	ham	ne	isey	batad-reej	rah	rah	kar	utāra

arabicText: قُلْ ءَامِنُوا۟ بِهِۦٓ أَوْ لَا تُؤْمِنُوٓا۟ ۚ إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُوا۟ ٱلْعِلْمَ مِن قَبْلِهِۦٓ إِذَا يُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِمْ يَخِرُّونَ لِلْأَذْقَانِ سُجَّدًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Proclaim,	“Whether	you	accept	 faith	in	it	or	
not”;	indeed	those	who	received	knowledge	
before	the	Qur’an	came,	fall	down	prostrate	
on	their	faces	when	it	is	recited	to	them.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	farmāo	ke	tum	log	is	par	Imān lāo	ya na	
lāo	be	shak	woh	jinheñ	is	ke	utarne	se	pehle	
Ílm	mila	jab	un	par	padha	jāta	hai	thodi	ke	bal	
sajde	meiñ	gir	padhte	haiñ

arabicText: وَيَقُولُونَ سُبْحَـٰنَ رَبِّنَآ إِن كَانَ وَعْدُ رَبِّنَا لَمَفْعُولًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	 they	 say,	 “Purity	is	 to	 our	 Lord	- indeed	
the	promise	of	our	Lord	had	to	come	true.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	kahte	haiñ	pāki	hai	hamāre	Rab	ko	beshak		hamare	Rab	ka	w’āda		pura	hona	tha.

arabicText: وَيَخِرُّونَ لِلْأَذْقَانِ يَبْكُونَ وَيَزِيدُهُمْ خُشُوعًۭا ۩
englishTranslationText:
And	 they	 fall	 down	 on	 their	 faces	 weeping,	
and	 this	 Qur’an	 increases	 their	 humility.	
(Command of Prostration # 4).
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	thodi	ke	bal	girte	haiñ	rote	huwe	aur	yeh	
Qurāñ	un	ke	dil	ka	jhukna	badhāta	hai.
(Sajde	ka	hukm	#4)

arabicText: قُلِ ٱدْعُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ أَوِ ٱدْعُوا۟ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنَ ۖ أَيًّۭا مَّا تَدْعُوا۟ فَلَهُ ٱلْأَسْمَآءُ ٱلْحُسْنَىٰ ۚ وَلَا تَجْهَرْ بِصَلَاتِكَ وَلَا تُخَافِتْ بِهَا وَٱبْتَغِ بَيْنَ ذَٰلِكَ سَبِيلًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Proclaim,	“Pray	calling	(Him)	Allah or	calling	
(Him)	 the	 Most	 Gracious;	 whichever	 name	
you	 call	 with	- they	 are	 all	 His	 magnificent	
names;	 and	 do	 not	 offer	 your	 prayers	 very	
loudly	 or	 very	 softly,	 and	 seek	 a	 way	
between	them.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	 farmāo	 Allah	 kah	 kar	 pukāro	 ya	
Rahmān	kah	kar	jo	kah	kar	pukāro	sab	usi	ke	
achchhe	 nām	 haiñ	 aur	 apni	 amāz	 na	 bahut	
āwāz	se	padho	na	bilkul	āhista	aur	un	donoñ	
ke	beech	meiñ	rāsta	chāho.

arabicText: وَقُلِ ٱلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ ٱلَّذِى لَمْ يَتَّخِذْ وَلَدًۭا وَلَمْ يَكُن لَّهُۥ شَرِيكٌۭ فِى ٱلْمُلْكِ وَلَمْ يَكُن لَّهُۥ وَلِىٌّۭ مِّنَ ٱلذُّلِّ ۖ وَكَبِّرْهُ تَكْبِيرًۢا
englishTranslationText:
And	say,	“All	praise	is	to	Allah,	Who	has	not	
chosen	 a	 son	 for	 Himself,	 and	 none	 is	 His	
partner	 in	 kingship,	 and	 none	 is	 His	
supporter	due	to	weakness,	and	say	‘Allah is	
Great’	to	proclaim	His	greatness.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	yuñ kaho	sab	khoobiyāñ	Allah	ko	jis	ne	
apne	 liye	 bachcha	 ikhtiyār	 na	 farmāya	 aur	
bādshāhi	meiñ	 koi	us	 ka	shareek	nahiñ	aur	
kamzori	 se	 koi	 us	 ka	 himāyati	 aur	 us	 ki	
badhāi	bolne	ko	takbeer	kaho

arabicText: ٱلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ ٱلَّذِىٓ أَنزَلَ عَلَىٰ عَبْدِهِ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ وَلَمْ يَجْعَل لَّهُۥ عِوَجَاۜ
englishTranslationText:
All	praise	is	to	Allah Who	sent	down	the	Book	upon	His	bondman,	and	has	not	kept	any	deviation	in	
it.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Sab	khubiyāñ	Allah	ko	Jis	ne	apne	bande	par	Kitāb	utāri	aur	us	meiñ	aslan	kaji	na	rakhi	(Zarā	bhi	tedha	
pan	na	rakhā)

arabicText: قَيِّمًۭا لِّيُنذِرَ بَأْسًۭا شَدِيدًۭا مِّن لَّدُنْهُ وَيُبَشِّرَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ ٱلَّذِينَ يَعْمَلُونَ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ أَنَّ لَهُمْ أَجْرًا حَسَنًۭا
englishTranslationText:
A	just	Book,	to	warn	of	Allah’s	severe	punishment,	and	to	give	glad	tidings	to	the	believers	who	do	
good	deeds,	that	for	them	is	an	excellent	reward.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ádl	wāli	kitāb	ke	Allah	sakht	‘aƶāb	se	darāye	aur	Imān wāloñ	ko	jo	nek	kām	kareñ	bashārat	de	ke	un			
ke	liye	achcha	ṣawāb	hai

arabicText: مَّـٰكِثِينَ فِيهِ أَبَدًۭا
englishTranslationText: In	which	they	will	abide forever
romanUrduTranslationText: Jis	meiñ	hamesha	raheñ	ge.	aur

arabicText: وَيُنذِرَ ٱلَّذِينَ قَالُوا۟ ٱتَّخَذَ ٱللَّهُ وَلَدًۭا
englishTranslationText: And	to	warn	those	who	say	“Allah has	chosen	a	child.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur		Un	ko	darāye	jo	kahte	haiñ	ke	Allah	ne	apna	koi	bachcha	banāya

arabicText: مَّا لَهُم بِهِۦ مِنْ عِلْمٍۢ وَلَا لِـَٔابَآئِهِمْ ۚ كَبُرَتْ كَلِمَةًۭ تَخْرُجُ مِنْ أَفْوَٰهِهِمْ ۚ إِن يَقُولُونَ إِلَّا كَذِبًۭا
englishTranslationText:
They	 do	 not	 have	 any	 knowledge	 of	 it	 -
nor	did	 their	 forefathers;	profound	is	 the	
word	that	comes	out	of	their	mouths;	they	
only	speak	a	lie.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Is	bāre	meiñ	na	woh	kuchh	Ílm	rakhte	haiñ	
na	unke	bāp	dada	kitnā	badā	bol	hai	ke	un	
ke	muñh			se	nikalta	hai	nira	(Bilkul)	jhooñt	
kah	raheñ	hai

arabicText: فَلَعَلَّكَ بَـٰخِعٌۭ نَّفْسَكَ عَلَىٰٓ ءَاثَـٰرِهِمْ إِن لَّمْ يُؤْمِنُوا۟ بِهَـٰذَا ٱلْحَدِيثِ أَسَفًا
englishTranslationText:
Possibly	 you	 may	 risk	 your	 life	 by	
grieving	 (O	 dear	 Prophet	 Muhammad -
peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him)	for	them	
if	they	do	not	believe	in	this	narration.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	kahiñ	tum	apni	jān	par	khel	jāoge	un	ke	
piche	 agar	 woh	is	 bāt	 par	Imān na	 lāyeñ	
gham	se

arabicText: إِنَّا جَعَلْنَا مَا عَلَى ٱلْأَرْضِ زِينَةًۭ لَّهَا لِنَبْلُوَهُمْ أَيُّهُمْ أَحْسَنُ عَمَلًۭا
englishTranslationText:
We	 have	 indeed	 placed	 all	 that	 is	 on	 the	
earth	 as	 its	 adornment	 in	 order	 that	 We	
may	 test	 them,	who	among	 them	 has	 the	
best	deeds.
romanUrduTranslationText:
.Be-shak	Hum	ne	zameen	ka	singār	kiya	jo	
kuchh	 us	 par	 hai	 ke	 unheñ	 āazmāye	 un	
meiñ	kis	ke	kām	behtar	haiñ

arabicText: وَإِنَّا لَجَـٰعِلُونَ مَا عَلَيْهَا صَعِيدًۭا جُرُزًا
englishTranslationText:
And	 indeed	 We	 shall	 one	 day	 make	 all	
that	is	on	it	a	barren	plain.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	jo	kuchh	us	par	hai	ek	din	hum	
usey	pat	kar	(Chatyal,	baykār)	maidān	kar	
chhodeñ	ge

arabicText: أَمْ حَسِبْتَ أَنَّ أَصْحَـٰبَ ٱلْكَهْفِ وَٱلرَّقِيمِ كَانُوا۟ مِنْ ءَايَـٰتِنَا عَجَبًا
englishTranslationText:
Did	you	know	that	the	People	of	the	Cave	
and	People	close	 to	 the	Woods,	were	Our	
exceptional	signs?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kya	 tumhaiñ	 m’aloom	 huwa	 ke	 pahād	 ki	
khoh	aur	jangle	ke	kināre	wāle	humāri	aik	
‘ajib	nishāni	the?

arabicText: إِذْ أَوَى ٱلْفِتْيَةُ إِلَى ٱلْكَهْفِ فَقَالُوا۟ رَبَّنَآ ءَاتِنَا مِن لَّدُنكَ رَحْمَةًۭ وَهَيِّئْ لَنَا مِنْ أَمْرِنَا رَشَدًۭا
englishTranslationText:
When	 the	 young	 men	 took	 refuge	 in	 the	
Cave	- then	said,	“Our	Lord!	Give	us	mercy	
from	 Yourself,	 and	 arrange	 guidance	 for	
us	in	our	affair.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
.Jab	un	jawānoñ	ne	ghār	meiñ	panah	li	phir	
bole	Aey	humāre	Rab! Hameiñ	apne	pās	se	
Raḥmat	de!	Aur	humāre	 kām	me	humāre	
liye	rāh-yābi	(Rāh	Pāne) ke	sāmān	kar

arabicText: فَضَرَبْنَا عَلَىٰٓ ءَاذَانِهِمْ فِى ٱلْكَهْفِ سِنِينَ عَدَدًۭا
englishTranslationText:
We	 then	 thumped	 upon	 their	 ears	in	 the	
Cave	for	a	number	of	years.	(*	Put	them	to	
sleep.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	hum	ne	us	ghār	me	meiñ	un	ke	kānoñ	
par	ginti	ke	kai	baras	thapka

arabicText: ثُمَّ بَعَثْنَـٰهُمْ لِنَعْلَمَ أَىُّ ٱلْحِزْبَيْنِ أَحْصَىٰ لِمَا لَبِثُوٓا۟ أَمَدًۭا
englishTranslationText:
We	then	awakened	them	to	see	which	of	the	two	groups	more	accurately	tells	the	period	they	
had	stayed.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	hum	ne	unheñ	jagāya	ke	dekheiñ	do	girhoñ	meiñ	koun	un	ke	thaherne	ki	muddat	ziyadah	
thik	batāta	hai.

arabicText: نَّحْنُ نَقُصُّ عَلَيْكَ نَبَأَهُم بِٱلْحَقِّ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ فِتْيَةٌ ءَامَنُوا۟ بِرَبِّهِمْ وَزِدْنَـٰهُمْ هُدًۭى
englishTranslationText:
We	shall	narrate	 their	account	 to	you	accurately;	 they	were	young	men	who	believed	in	 their	
Lord,	and	We	increased	the	guidance	for	them
romanUrduTranslationText:
Hum	un	ka	thik	thāk	hāl	tumheiñ	sunāyeñ	woh	kuchh	jawān	the	ke	apne	rab	par	im'ān	lāyeñ	aur	
hum	ne	un	ko	hidayat	badhāi

arabicText: نَّحْنُ نَقُصُّ عَلَيْكَ نَبَأَهُم بِٱلْحَقِّ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ فِتْيَةٌ ءَامَنُوا۟ بِرَبِّهِمْ وَزِدْنَـٰهُمْ هُدًۭى
englishTranslationText:
We	shall	narrate	 their	account	 to	you	accurately;	 they	were	young	men	who	believed	in	 their	
Lord,	and	We	increased	the	guidance	for	them
romanUrduTranslationText:
Hum	un	ka	thik	thāk	hāl	tumheiñ	sunāyeñ	woh	kuchh	jawān	the	ke	apne	rab	par	im'ān	lāyeñ	aur	
hum	ne	un	ko	hidayat	badhāi

arabicText: وَرَبَطْنَا عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِمْ إِذْ قَامُوا۟ فَقَالُوا۟ رَبُّنَا رَبُّ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ لَن نَّدْعُوَا۟ مِن دُونِهِۦٓ إِلَـٰهًۭا ۖ لَّقَدْ قُلْنَآ إِذًۭا شَطَطًا
englishTranslationText:
And	We	made	their	hearts	steadfast	when	they	stood	up	and	said,	“Our	Lord	is	the	Lord	of	the	
heavens	and	the	earth	- we	shall	not	worship	any	other	deity	except	Him	- if	it	were,	we	have	
then	said something	excessive.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	hum	ne	un	ke	Diloñ	dhāras	bandhāi	jab	khade	ho	kar	boleñ	ke	humāra	Rab	woh	hai	jo	āasmān	
aur	zameen	ka	Rab	hai	hum	us	ke	siwa	kisi	m’abood	ko	na	poojeiñ	ge	aisa	ho	to	hum	ne	zaroor	
had	se	guzri	huwi	bāt	kahi

arabicText: هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ قَوْمُنَا ٱتَّخَذُوا۟ مِن دُونِهِۦٓ ءَالِهَةًۭ ۖ لَّوْلَا يَأْتُونَ عَلَيْهِم بِسُلْطَـٰنٍۭ بَيِّنٍۢ ۖ فَمَنْ أَظْلَمُ مِمَّنِ ٱفْتَرَىٰ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ كَذِبًۭا
englishTranslationText:
“These	- the	people	of	ours	- have	set	up	Gods	besides	Allah;	why	do	they	not	bring	a	clear	proof	
regarding	them?	And	who	is	more	unjust	than	one	who	fabricates	a	lie	against	Allah?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
.Yeh	jo	humāri	qoum	hai	us	ne	Allah	ke	siwa	khuda	bana	rakhe	haiñ	kyuñ	nahiñ	lāte	un	par	koi	
roshan	sanad	to	us	se	badh	kar	ẓalim	koun?	Jo	Allah	par	jhooñt	bāndhe

arabicText: وَإِذِ ٱعْتَزَلْتُمُوهُمْ وَمَا يَعْبُدُونَ إِلَّا ٱللَّهَ فَأْوُۥٓا۟ إِلَى ٱلْكَهْفِ يَنشُرْ لَكُمْ رَبُّكُم مِّن رَّحْمَتِهِۦ وَيُهَيِّئْ لَكُم مِّنْ أَمْرِكُم مِّرْفَقًۭا
englishTranslationText:
“And	 when	 you	 have	 disassociated	
yourself	 from	 them	 and	 all	 what	 they	
worship	 besides	Allah - so	 take	 refuge	in	
the	 Cave	 - your	 Lord	 will	 spread	 His	
mercy	for	you	and	arrange	ease	for	you	in	
your	affairs.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jab	tum	un	se	aur	jo	kuch	wo	Allah	ke	
siwa	poojte	haiñ	sab	se	alag	ho	jāo	to	ghār	
meiñ	panāh	lo	 tumhāra	Rab	tumhāre	liye	
apni	raḥmat	phailā	de	ga	aur	tumhāre	kām	
meiñ	āsāni	ke	sāmān	bana	de	ga.

arabicText: ۞ وَتَرَى ٱلشَّمْسَ إِذَا طَلَعَت تَّزَٰوَرُ عَن كَهْفِهِمْ ذَاتَ ٱلْيَمِينِ وَإِذَا غَرَبَت تَّقْرِضُهُمْ ذَاتَ ٱلشِّمَالِ وَهُمْ فِى فَجْوَةٍۢ مِّنْهُ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ مِنْ ءَايَـٰتِ ٱللَّهِ ۗ مَن يَهْدِ ٱللَّهُ فَهُوَ ٱلْمُهْتَدِ ۖ وَمَن يُضْلِلْ فَلَن تَجِدَ لَهُۥ وَلِيًّۭا مُّرْشِدًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	 O	 dear	 Prophet	(Muhammad - peace	
and	 blessings	 be	 upon	 him)	 you	 will	 see	
the	sun	that	when	it	rises	it	shifts	away	to	
the	right	of	their	cave,	and	when	it	sets	it	
shifts	 away	 to	 their	 left,	 and	 they	 are	 in	
the	open	ground	of	that	cave;	this	is	from	
among	the	signs	of	Allah;	whomever	Allah
guides	- only	 he	is	 therefore	 guided;	 and	
whomever	 He	 sends	 astray	 - you	 will	
never	find	for	him	a	friend	who	guides.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	aey	Mehboob" Tum	suraj	ko	dekhoñ	ge	
ke	jab	nikalta	hai	 to	un	ke	ghār	se	dāhini	
taraf	bachh	jāta	hai	aur	jab	doobta	hai	 to	
unheiñ	bāyiñ	taraf	katra	jāta	hai	hālāñ	ke	
woh	us	ghār	ke	khule	meiñdān	meiñ	haiñ	
yeh	 Allah	 ki	 nishāniyoñ	 meiñ	 se	 hai	 jise	
Allah	 rāh	 de	 to	wohi	 rāh	 par	 hai	 aur	jise	
gumrah	kare	to	hargiz	us	ka	koi	himāyati	
rāh	dikhāne		wāla		na	pāoge.

arabicText: وَتَحْسَبُهُمْ أَيْقَاظًۭا وَهُمْ رُقُودٌۭ ۚ وَنُقَلِّبُهُمْ ذَاتَ ٱلْيَمِينِ وَذَاتَ ٱلشِّمَالِ ۖ وَكَلْبُهُم بَـٰسِطٌۭ ذِرَاعَيْهِ بِٱلْوَصِيدِ ۚ لَوِ ٱطَّلَعْتَ عَلَيْهِمْ لَوَلَّيْتَ مِنْهُمْ فِرَارًۭا وَلَمُلِئْتَ مِنْهُمْ رُعْبًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	 you	 may	 think	 they	 are	 awake,	
whereas	 they	 are	 asleep;	 and	 We	 turn	
them	 over	 to	 the	 right	 and	 the	 left	- and	
their	 dog	is	on	 the	 threshold	 of	 the	 cave,	
with	 its	 paws	 outstretched;	 O	 listener,	
were	 you	 to	 look	 at	 them	 closely,	 you	
would	turn	back	running	away	from	them,	
and	be	filled	with	their	dread.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	tum	unheiñ	jāgta	samjho	aur	woh	sote	
haiñ	aur	hum	un	ki	dāhini	bāyiñ	karwaṭeñ	
badalte	haiñ	aur	un	ka	kutta	apni	kalāiyāñ	
phailāye	huwe	hai	ghār	ki	chaukhat	par	aey	sunne	wāle" Agar	tu	unheñ		jhāñk	kar	dekhe	to	un	se	
pith	pher	kar	bhāge	aur	un	se	haibat	meiñ	bhar	jāye

arabicText: وَكَذَٰلِكَ بَعَثْنَـٰهُمْ لِيَتَسَآءَلُوا۟ بَيْنَهُمْ ۚ قَالَ قَآئِلٌۭ مِّنْهُمْ كَمْ لَبِثْتُمْ ۖ قَالُوا۟ لَبِثْنَا يَوْمًا أَوْ بَعْضَ يَوْمٍۢ ۚ قَالُوا۟ رَبُّكُمْ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا لَبِثْتُمْ فَٱبْعَثُوٓا۟ أَحَدَكُم بِوَرِقِكُمْ هَـٰذِهِۦٓ إِلَى ٱلْمَدِينَةِ فَلْيَنظُرْ أَيُّهَآ أَزْكَىٰ طَعَامًۭا فَلْيَأْتِكُم بِرِزْقٍۢ مِّنْهُ وَلْيَتَلَطَّفْ وَلَا يُشْعِرَنَّ بِكُمْ أَحَدًا
englishTranslationText:
And	similarly	We	awakened	 them	so	 that	
they	 may	 enquire	 about	 each	 other;	 a
speaker	among	them	said,	“How	long	have	you	stayed	here?”	Some	among	them	said,	“We	have	
stayed	 a	 day	 or	 part	 of	 a	 day”;	 the	 others	 said,	 “Your	 Lord	 well	 knows	 how	 long	 you	 have	
stayed;	 therefore	 send	 one	 of	 you	 to	 the	 city	with	 this	 silver	 coin	- he	may	then	 check	which	
food	 available	 there	 is	 purer,	 in	 order	 to	 bring	 some	 of	 it	 for	 you	 to	 eat	 - and	 he	 must	 be	
courteous	and	not	inform	anyone	about	you.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	yuñ hi	Hum	ne	un	ko	jagāyā	ke	āpas	meiñ	ek	doosre	se	ahwāl	pucheñ	un	meiñ	ek	kahne	wāla	
bolā	tum	yahāñ	kitni	der	rahe	kuchh	bole	ke	ek	din	rahe	ya	din	se	kam	doosre	bole	tumhāra	Rab	
khoob	jānta	hai	jitna	tum	thahre	to	apne	meiñ	ek	ko	yeh	chandi	le	kar	shaher	meiñ	bhejo	phir	wo	
ghaur	kare	ke	wahāñ	koun	sā	khāna	ziyadah	suthrā	hai	ke	tumhāre	liye	us	meiñ	se	khāne	ko	lāye	
aur	chāhiye	ke	narmi	kare		aur	har	giz	kisi	ko	tumhāri		iṭtel'a	na	de

arabicText: إِنَّهُمْ إِن يَظْهَرُوا۟ عَلَيْكُمْ يَرْجُمُوكُمْ أَوْ يُعِيدُوكُمْ فِى مِلَّتِهِمْ وَلَن تُفْلِحُوٓا۟ إِذًا أَبَدًۭا
englishTranslationText:
“Indeed	if	they	come	to	know	about	you,	they	will	stone	you	or	turn	you	back	to	their	religion	-
and	if	so,	you	will	never	prosper.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak		agar	woh	tumheiñ	jān	leñ	ge	to	tumheiñ	pathrāo	kareñ	ge	yā	apne	deen	meiñ	pher	leñ	
ge	aur	aisā	huwa	to	tumhāra	kabhi	bhala	na	hogā

arabicText: وَكَذَٰلِكَ أَعْثَرْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ لِيَعْلَمُوٓا۟ أَنَّ وَعْدَ ٱللَّهِ حَقٌّۭ وَأَنَّ ٱلسَّاعَةَ لَا رَيْبَ فِيهَآ إِذْ يَتَنَـٰزَعُونَ بَيْنَهُمْ أَمْرَهُمْ ۖ فَقَالُوا۟ ٱبْنُوا۟ عَلَيْهِم بُنْيَـٰنًۭا ۖ رَّبُّهُمْ أَعْلَمُ بِهِمْ ۚ قَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ غَلَبُوا۟ عَلَىٰٓ أَمْرِهِمْ لَنَتَّخِذَنَّ عَلَيْهِم مَّسْجِدًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	this	is	how	We	made	them	known	for	
people	 to	know	 that	 the	promise	of	Allah
is	 true	 and	 that	 there	 is	 no	 doubt	
concerning	the	Last	Day;	when	the	people	
began	 disputing	 among	 themselves	
regarding	 them,	 they	 said,	 “Construct	 a	
building	 over	 their	 cave”;	 their	 Lord	well	
knows	them;	those	who	dominated	in	this	
matter	 said,	 “We	promise	we	will	build	a	
masjid over	them.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	isi	tarah	Hum	ne	un	ki	iṭtel'a	kar	di	ke	
log	jān	leñ	 ke	Allah	 ka	w’ādā	sachchā	hai	
aur	Qayāmat	meiñ	kuch	shuba'h		nahiñ	jab	
woh	log	un	ke	muamle	meiñ	bā	ham	jhagad	
ne	lage	to	bole	un	ke	ghār	par	koi		'imārat	
banāo	 un	 ka	 Rab	 inheñ	 khoob	 jānta	 hai	
woh	 bole	 jo	is	 kām	meiñ	 ghālib	 rahe	 the	
qasam	hai	ke	hum	to	un	par	masjid	banāeñ	
ge

arabicText: سَيَقُولُونَ ثَلَـٰثَةٌۭ رَّابِعُهُمْ كَلْبُهُمْ وَيَقُولُونَ خَمْسَةٌۭ سَادِسُهُمْ كَلْبُهُمْ رَجْمًۢا بِٱلْغَيْبِ ۖ وَيَقُولُونَ سَبْعَةٌۭ وَثَامِنُهُمْ كَلْبُهُمْ ۚ قُل رَّبِّىٓ أَعْلَمُ بِعِدَّتِهِم مَّا يَعْلَمُهُمْ إِلَّا قَلِيلٌۭ ۗ فَلَا تُمَارِ فِيهِمْ إِلَّا مِرَآءًۭ ظَـٰهِرًۭا وَلَا تَسْتَفْتِ فِيهِم مِّنْهُمْ أَحَدًۭا
englishTranslationText:
So	 the	 people	 will	 now	 say,	 “They	 are	
three,	 their	 dog	 is	 the	 fourth”;	 and	 some	
will	 say,	 “They	 are	 five,	 their	 dog	 is	 the	
sixth”	- just	 blind	guesses;	and	 some	will	
say,	“They	are	seven,	and	 their	dog	is	 the	
eighth”;	 proclaim	 (O	 dear	 Prophet	
Muhammad - peace	and	blessings	be	upon	
him),	“My	Lord	well	knows	their	number	-
no	 one	 knows	 them	 except	 a	 few”;	
therefore	do	not	debate	concerning	 them	
except	what	has	occurred,	and	do	not	ask	
any	of	the	People	of	the	Book(s)	anything	
concerning	them.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ab	kaheñge	ke	woh	tin	haiñ	chauthā	unkā	
kuttā	 aur	 kuchh	 kaheñge pānch	 haiñ	
chhata	 unkā	 kuttā	 be	 dekhe	 alāo	 tuhkā	
(betuki)	 bāt	 aur	 kuchh	 kaheñge	 sāt	 haiñ	
aur	āñthwañ	un	ka	kuttā	tum	farmāo	merā	
Rab	 un	 ki	 ginti	 khoob	 jānta	 hai	 unheñ	
nahiñ	 jānte	 magar	 thode	 to	 un	 ke	 bāre	
meiñ	 baheṣ na	 karo	 magar	 itni	 hi	 baheṣ
karo	jo	ẓāhir	ho	chuki	aur	un	ke	bāre	meiñ	
kisi	kitābi	se	kuchh	na	puñcho.

arabicText: وَلَا تَقُولَنَّ لِشَا۟ىْءٍ إِنِّى فَاعِلٌۭ ذَٰلِكَ غَدًا
englishTranslationText:
And	never	say	about	anything	that,	“I	will	
do	this	tomorrow.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	hargiz	kisi	bāt	ko	na	kahnā	ke	meiñ	kal	
yeh	karduñ	gā

arabicText: إِلَّآ أَن يَشَآءَ ٱللَّهُ ۚ وَٱذْكُر رَّبَّكَ إِذَا نَسِيتَ وَقُلْ عَسَىٰٓ أَن يَهْدِيَنِ رَبِّى لِأَقْرَبَ مِنْ هَـٰذَا رَشَدًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Except	 “If	 Allah wills”;	 and	 remember	
your	Lord	when	you	forget,	and	say,	“It	is	
likely	that	my	Lord	will	guide	me	to	a	more	accurate	way	of	virtue	than	this.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Magar	yeh	ke	Allah	chāhe	aur	apne	Rab	ki	
yād	kar	jab	tu	bhool	jāye	aur	yooñ	kaho	ke	
qarib	hai	mera	Rab	mujhe	is	se	nazdik	tar	rāsti	(Hidāyat)	ki	rāh	dikhāye.

arabicText: وَلَبِثُوا۟ فِى كَهْفِهِمْ ثَلَـٰثَ مِا۟ئَةٍۢ سِنِينَ وَٱزْدَادُوا۟ تِسْعًۭا
englishTranslationText: And	they	stayed	in	their	Cave	for	three	hundred years	and	nine	more.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	woh	apne	ghār	meiñ	tin	sau	baras	thahre	nau	upar

arabicText: قُلِ ٱللَّهُ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا لَبِثُوا۟ ۖ لَهُۥ غَيْبُ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۖ أَبْصِرْ بِهِۦ وَأَسْمِعْ ۚ مَا لَهُم مِّن دُونِهِۦ مِن وَلِىٍّۢ وَلَا يُشْرِكُ فِى حُكْمِهِۦٓ أَحَدًۭا ٢٦
englishTranslationText:
Say,	“Allah well	knows	how	long	 they	stayed;	 for	Him	only	are	 the	hidden	of	 the	heavens	and	
the	earth;	how	well	He	sees	and	hears!	They	do	not	have	any	supporter	besides	Him;	and	He	
does	not	associate	anyone	in	His	command.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	farmāo	Allah	khoob	jānta	hai	wo	jitnā	thahre	usi	ke	liye	haiñ	āasmānoñ	aur	zameenoñ	ke	
sab	ghaib	woh	kya	hi	dekhtā	aur	suntā	hai	is	ke	siwa	un	ka	koi	wāli	nahiñ	aur	woh	apne	ḥukmmeiñ	
kisi	ko	sharik	nahiñ	kartā

arabicText: وَٱتْلُ مَآ أُوحِىَ إِلَيْكَ مِن كِتَابِ رَبِّكَ ۖ لَا مُبَدِّلَ لِكَلِمَـٰتِهِۦ وَلَن تَجِدَ مِن دُونِهِۦ مُلْتَحَدًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	recite	 the	Book	of	your	Lord	which	has	been	divinely	revealed	 to	you;	 there	is	none	who	
can	change	His	Words;	and	you	will	never	find	a	refuge	besides	Him.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	tilawat	karo	jo	tumhāre	Rab	ki	kitāb	tumheñ	waḥi	hui	is	ki	bātoñ	ka	koi	badalne	wāla	nahiñ	
aur	hargiz	tum	us	ke	siwa	panah	na	pāoge

arabicText: وَٱصْبِرْ نَفْسَكَ مَعَ ٱلَّذِينَ يَدْعُونَ رَبَّهُم بِٱلْغَدَوٰةِ وَٱلْعَشِىِّ يُرِيدُونَ وَجْهَهُۥ ۖ وَلَا تَعْدُ عَيْنَاكَ عَنْهُمْ تُرِيدُ زِينَةَ ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا ۖ وَلَا تُطِعْ مَنْ أَغْفَلْنَا قَلْبَهُۥ عَن ذِكْرِنَا وَٱتَّبَعَ هَوَىٰهُ وَكَانَ أَمْرُهُۥ فُرُطًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	 restrain	 yourself	 along	 with	 those	
who	 pray	 to	 their	 Lord	 morning	 and	
evening,	 seeking	 His	 pleasure;	 and	 may	
not	 your	 sight	 fall	 on	 anything	 besides	
them;	would	you	desire	the	adornment	of	
the	 life	 of	 this	 world?	 And	 do	 not	 follow	
him	 whose	 heart	 We	 have	 made	
neglectful	of	Our	remembrance	– the	one	
who	has	followed	his	own	desires	and	his	
matter	has	crossed	the	limits.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	apni	jān	un	se	mānoos	rakho	jo	subahwa-shām	apne	Rab	ko	pukārte	haiñ	us	ki	
riza	 chāhte	 haiñ	 aur	 tumhāri	 ānkheñ	
unheñ	chord	kar	aur	par	na	padeñ	kya	tum	
dunyā	 ki	 zindgāni	 ka	 singār	 (Zeenat)	
chaho	ge	aur	us	ka	kahā	na	mānoñ	jis	ka	dil	
hum	ne	apni	yād	se ghāfil	kar	diyā	aur	woh	
apni	 khwahish	 ke	 piche	 chalā	 aur	 us	 ka	
kām	had	se	guzar	gayā

arabicText: وَقُلِ ٱلْحَقُّ مِن رَّبِّكُمْ ۖ فَمَن شَآءَ فَلْيُؤْمِن وَمَن شَآءَ فَلْيَكْفُرْ ۚ إِنَّآ أَعْتَدْنَا لِلظَّـٰلِمِينَ نَارًا أَحَاطَ بِهِمْ سُرَادِقُهَا ۚ وَإِن يَسْتَغِيثُوا۟ يُغَاثُوا۟ بِمَآءٍۢ كَٱلْمُهْلِ يَشْوِى ٱلْوُجُوهَ ۚ بِئْسَ ٱلشَّرَابُ وَسَآءَتْ مُرْتَفَقًا
englishTranslationText:
And	 proclaim,	 “The	 Truth	 is	 from	 your	
Lord”;	so	whoever	wills	may	accept	 faith,	
and	 whoever	 wills	 may	 disbelieve	 - We	
have	indeed	prepared	for	the	disbelievers	
a	 fire	 the	 walls	 of	 which	 will	 surround	
them;	 if	 they	 plead	 for	 water,	 their	 plea	
will	 be	 answered	 with	 water	 like	 molten	
metal	 which	 shall	 scald	 their	 faces;	 what	
an	 evil	 drink	 it	 is;	 and	 what	 an	 evil	
destination	is	hell!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	farmā	do	ke	haq	tumhāre	Rab	ki	taraf	
se	hai	 to	jo	chāhe	Imān lāye	aur jo	chāhe	
kufr	kare	be-shak	Hum	ne	ẓālimoñ	ke	liye	
woh	āag	tayyār	kar	rakhi	hai	jis	ki	diwāreñ	
unheñ	 gher	 leñgi	 aur	 agar	 pāni	 ke	 liye	
faryād	 kareñ	 to	 un	 ki	 faryād	 rasi	 hogi	 us	
pāni	se	ke	charkh	diye	(pighle)	huwe	dhāt	
ki	 tarah	 hai	 ke	muñh	 	 bhoon	 (jala)	 de	ga	
kya	hi	bura	peenā	aur	Dozakh	kya	hi	buri	
thaherne	ki	jagah

arabicText: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ إِنَّا لَا نُضِيعُ أَجْرَ مَنْ أَحْسَنَ عَمَلًا
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	those	 who	 believed	 and	 did	 good	
deeds	 - We	 do	 not	 waste	 the	 reward	 of	
those	whose	deeds	are	good.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	 	 jo	 Imān lāye	 aur nek	 kām	 kiye	
hum	un	ke	neg	(ajr)	zā'e	nahiñ	karte	jin	ke	
kām	achche	hoñ

arabicText: أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ لَهُمْ جَنَّـٰتُ عَدْنٍۢ تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهِمُ ٱلْأَنْهَـٰرُ يُحَلَّوْنَ فِيهَا مِنْ أَسَاوِرَ مِن ذَهَبٍۢ وَيَلْبَسُونَ ثِيَابًا خُضْرًۭا مِّن سُندُسٍۢ وَإِسْتَبْرَقٍۢ مُّتَّكِـِٔينَ فِيهَا عَلَى ٱلْأَرَآئِكِ ۚ نِعْمَ ٱلثَّوَابُ وَحَسُنَتْ مُرْتَفَقًۭا
englishTranslationText:
For	them	are	everlasting	Gardens	of	Eden,	
beneath	which	rivers	flow	- in	it	they	will	
be	 given	 bracelets	 of	 gold	 to	 adorn,	 and	
shall	wear	green	clothes	made	of	fine	silk	
and	 gold	 embroidery,	 reclining	 upon	
thrones	 in	 it;	 what	 an	 excellent	 reward;	
and	what	an	excellent	abode	is	Paradise!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Un	ke	liye	basne	ke	bagh	haiñ	un	ke	niche	
nadiyāñ	 baheñ	 woh	 is	 meiñ	 sone	 ke	
kangan	pehnāye	jāyeñ	ge	aur	 sabz	 kapde	
kareb	 (resham	 ke	 barik)	 kanādez	 (mote)	
ke	 pahneñ	 ge	 wahañ	 takhtoñ	 par	 takiya	
lagāye	kya	hi	achcha	ṣawab	aur	jannat	kya	
hi	achchi	āarām	ki	jagah.

arabicText: ۞ وَٱضْرِبْ لَهُم مَّثَلًۭا رَّجُلَيْنِ جَعَلْنَا لِأَحَدِهِمَا جَنَّتَيْنِ مِنْ أَعْنَـٰبٍۢ وَحَفَفْنَـٰهُمَا بِنَخْلٍۢ وَجَعَلْنَا بَيْنَهُمَا زَرْعًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	 relate	 to	 them	 the	account	 of	 the	 two	men	- to	 one	We	gave	 two	gardens	 of	grapes,	and	
covered	them	with	date-palms	and	kept	farms	between	them.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	un	ke	sāmne	do	mardoñ	ka	hāl	bayān	karo	ke	un	meiñ	ek	ko	hum	ne	angooroñ	ke	bāgh	diye	
aur	un	ko	khajooroñ	se	dhāñp	liyā	aur	un	ke	bich	bich	meiñ	kheti	rakhi

arabicText: كِلْتَا ٱلْجَنَّتَيْنِ ءَاتَتْ أُكُلَهَا وَلَمْ تَظْلِم مِّنْهُ شَيْـًۭٔا ۚ وَفَجَّرْنَا خِلَـٰلَهُمَا نَهَرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Both	the	gardens	gave	yields	and	gave	no	shortfall	in	it	- and	We	made	a	river	to	flow	between	
the	two.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Donoñ	bāgh	apne	phal	lāye	aur	is	meiñ	kuchh	kami	na	di	aur	donoñ	ke	bich	meiñ	hum	ne	naher	
banāi

arabicText: وَكَانَ لَهُۥ ثَمَرٌۭ فَقَالَ لِصَـٰحِبِهِۦ وَهُوَ يُحَاوِرُهُۥٓ أَنَا۠ أَكْثَرُ مِنكَ مَالًۭا وَأَعَزُّ نَفَرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	 he	 had	 fruit;	 he	 therefore	 said	 to	 his	 companion	- and	 he	 used	 to	 debate	 with	 him	- “I	
exceed	you	in	wealth,	and	am	more	powerful	in	respect	of	men.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	woh	phal	rakhtā	thā	to	apne	sāthi	se	bolā	aur	woh	isse	radd-o-badal	(tabādla-e-khayāl)	kartā	
thā	meiñ	tujh	se	māl	meiñ	ziyadah	huñ	aur	āadmiyo	ka	ziyādā	zor	rakhtā	huñ

arabicText: وَدَخَلَ جَنَّتَهُۥ وَهُوَ ظَالِمٌۭ لِّنَفْسِهِۦ قَالَ مَآ أَظُنُّ أَن تَبِيدَ هَـٰذِهِۦٓ أَبَدًۭا
englishTranslationText:
. He	 went	 into	 his	 garden	 and	 wronging	
himself	said,	 “I	do	not	 think	 that	 this	will	
ever	perish.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Apne	bāgh	meiñ	gayā	aur	apni	jān	par	ẓulm	
kartā	 huwā	 bolā	 mujhe	 gumān	 nahiñ	 ke	
yeh	kabhi	fanā	ho

arabicText: وَدَخَلَ جَنَّتَهُۥ وَهُوَ ظَالِمٌۭ لِّنَفْسِهِۦ قَالَ مَآ أَظُنُّ أَن تَبِيدَ هَـٰذِهِۦٓ أَبَدًۭا
englishTranslationText:
. He	 went	 into	 his	 garden	 and	 wronging	
himself	said,	 “I	do	not	 think	 that	 this	will	
ever	perish.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Apne	bāgh	meiñ	gayā	aur	apni	jān	par	ẓulm	
kartā	 huwā	 bolā	 mujhe	 gumān	 nahiñ	 ke	
yeh	kabhi	fanā	ho

arabicText: وَمَآ أَظُنُّ ٱلسَّاعَةَ قَآئِمَةًۭ وَلَئِن رُّدِدتُّ إِلَىٰ رَبِّى لَأَجِدَنَّ خَيْرًۭا مِّنْهَا مُنقَلَبًۭا
englishTranslationText:
. “I	do	not	think	that	the	Last	Day	will	ever	
be	established	- and	even	if	I	return	to	my	
Lord	I	will	surely	find	a	haven	better	than	
this	garden.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	maiñ	gumān	nahiñ	 kartā	 ke	qayāmat	
qāyim	ho	aur	agar	meiñ	apne	Rab	ki		taraf	
phir	 kar	 bhi	 to	 zaroor	 is	 bagh	 se	 behtar	
palatne	ki	jagah	pāuñ	ga

arabicText: قَالَ لَهُۥ صَاحِبُهُۥ وَهُوَ يُحَاوِرُهُۥٓ أَكَفَرْتَ بِٱلَّذِى خَلَقَكَ مِن تُرَابٍۢ ثُمَّ مِن نُّطْفَةٍۢ ثُمَّ سَوَّىٰكَ رَجُلًۭا
englishTranslationText:
His	 companion	 debating	 with	 him	
answered,	 “What!	 You	 disbelieve	 in	 Him	
Who	has	created	you	from	dust,	then	from	
a	drop	of	liquid,	and	then	created	you	as	a	
complete	man?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
.Us	 ke	 sāthi	 ne	 us	 se	 ulat	 pher	 (baheṣ o	
mubāhasha)	karte	huye	jawāb	diyā	kya	tu	
us	ke	sāth	kufr	kartā	hai	jis	ne	tujhe	mitti	
se	banāyā	phir	nithre	(sāf-wa-shaffāf)	pāni	
ki	boond se	phir	tujhe	thik	mard	kiya

arabicText: لَّـٰكِنَّا۠ هُوَ ٱللَّهُ رَبِّى وَلَآ أُشْرِكُ بِرَبِّىٓ أَحَدًۭا
englishTranslationText:
“But	 I	just	say	that	only	Allah is	my	Lord,	
and	 I	 do	 not	ascribe	anyone	as	a	 partner	
to	my	Lord.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Lekin	 meiñ	 to	 yahi	 kahtā	 hooñ	 ke	 woh	
Allah	hi	merā	Rab	hai	aur	maiñ	kisi	ko	apne	
Rab	ka	sharik	nahiñ	kartā	hooñ.

arabicText: وَلَوْلَآ إِذْ دَخَلْتَ جَنَّتَكَ قُلْتَ مَا شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ لَا قُوَّةَ إِلَّا بِٱللَّهِ ۚ إِن تَرَنِ أَنَا۠ أَقَلَّ مِنكَ مَالًۭا وَوَلَدًۭا
englishTranslationText:
“And	why	was	it	not	that	you	would	have	
said	 when	 you	 entered	 your	 garden,	
‘Whatever	 Allah wills	 - we	 do	 not	 have	
any	strength	except	with	the	help	of	Allah’	
- if	 you	had	observed	me	lesser	 than	 you	
in	wealth	and	children.”?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 kyuñ	 na	 huwa	 ke	 jab	 tu	 apne	 bāgh	
meiñ	 gayá	 to	 kahā	 hotā	 jo	 chāhe	 Allah	
humeiñ	 kuchh	 zor	 nahiñ	 magar	 Allah	 ki
madad	 agar	 tu	 mujhe	 apne	 se	 māl-waawlād	meiñ	kam	dekhtā	thá.

arabicText: فَعَسَىٰ رَبِّىٓ أَن يُؤْتِيَنِ خَيْرًۭا مِّن جَنَّتِكَ وَيُرْسِلَ عَلَيْهَا حُسْبَانًۭا مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ فَتُصْبِحَ صَعِيدًۭا زَلَقًا
englishTranslationText:
“So	it	is likely	that	my	Lord	will	give	me	a	
garden	 better	 than	 yours,	 and	 send	 bolts	
of	lightning	from	the	skies	on	your	garden	
- it	therefore	turns	into	a	barren	plain.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tu	qarib	hai	ke	mera	Rab	mujhe	tere	bāgh	
se	achchha	de	aur	tere	bāgh	par	āasmān	se	
bijliyāñ	 utāre	 to	 woh	 pat	 par	 maidān	
(chatiyal	bekār)	ho	kar	rah	jāye

arabicText: أَوْ يُصْبِحَ مَآؤُهَا غَوْرًۭا فَلَن تَسْتَطِيعَ لَهُۥ طَلَبًۭا
englishTranslationText:
“Or	 its	 water	 may	 sink	 into	 the	 earth,	 so	
you	may	never	be	able	to	find	it.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yā	is	ka	pāni	zameen	meiñ	dhañs	jāye	phir	
tu	ise	hargiz	talāsh	na	kar	sake.

arabicText: وَأُحِيطَ بِثَمَرِهِۦ فَأَصْبَحَ يُقَلِّبُ كَفَّيْهِ عَلَىٰ مَآ أَنفَقَ فِيهَا وَهِىَ خَاوِيَةٌ عَلَىٰ عُرُوشِهَا وَيَقُولُ يَـٰلَيْتَنِى لَمْ أُشْرِكْ بِرَبِّىٓ أَحَدًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	his	fruits were	surrounded	- he	therefore	remained	helplessly	wringing	his	hands	upon	all	
that	he	had	spent	on	it	- and	it	lay	fallen	on	its	canopy	- and	he	says,	“If	only	I	had	not	ascribed	
any	partner	to	my	Lord!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	us	ke	phal	gher	liye	gaye	to	apne	hāth	malta	rah	gayā	us	lāgat	par	jo	us	bāgh	meiñ	kharch	ki	
thi	aur	woh	apni	taddiyoñ(chapparoñ)	par	gira	huwa	tha	aur	kah	raha	hai	aey	kāsh	meiñ	ne	apne	
Rab	ka	kisi	ko	sharik	na	kiyā	hotā.

arabicText: وَلَمْ تَكُن لَّهُۥ فِئَةٌۭ يَنصُرُونَهُۥ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ وَمَا كَانَ مُنتَصِرًا
englishTranslationText: And	he	had	no	group	to	help	him	against	Allah,	nor	was	he	capable	of	taking	revenge.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	is	ke	pās	koi	jamā'at	na	thi	ke	Allah	ke	sāmne	us	ki	madad	karti	na	woh	badla	lene	(ke)	qābil	
thā.

arabicText: هُنَالِكَ ٱلْوَلَـٰيَةُ لِلَّهِ ٱلْحَقِّ ۚ هُوَ خَيْرٌۭ ثَوَابًۭا وَخَيْرٌ عُقْبًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Here	brought	to	light	is	that	the	authority	is	only	for	Allah,	the	True;	the	reward	He	bestows	is	
the	best,	and	believing	in	Him	has	the	best	outcome.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yahañ	khultā	hai	ke	ikhtiyār	sachche	Allah	ka	hai	us	ka	sawab	sabse	behtar	aur	usey	mānne	ka	
anjām	sabse	bhalā

arabicText: وَٱضْرِبْ لَهُم مَّثَلَ ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا كَمَآءٍ أَنزَلْنَـٰهُ مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ فَٱخْتَلَطَ بِهِۦ نَبَاتُ ٱلْأَرْضِ فَأَصْبَحَ هَشِيمًۭا تَذْرُوهُ ٱلرِّيَـٰحُ ۗ وَكَانَ ٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍۢ مُّقْتَدِرًا
englishTranslationText:
And	relate	to	them	the	example	of	the	life	of	this	world	- like	water	which	We	sent	down	from	
the	sky,	 therefore	 vegetation	of	 the	earth	grew	 forth	in	abundance	with	it	 to	become	dry	hay	
which	the	winds	scatter;	and	Allah is	the	Controller	of	all	things.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	un	ke	sāmne	zindgāniye	dunya	ki	kahāwat	bayān	karo	jaise	ek	pāni	ham	ne	āasmān	se	utāra	
to	us	ke	sabab	zameen	ka	sabza	ghana	ho	kar	nikla	ke	sookhi	ghās	ho	gayā	jise	hawāyeiñ	udāyeiñ	
aur	Allah	har	chiz	par	qābu	wāla	hai

arabicText: ٱلْمَالُ وَٱلْبَنُونَ زِينَةُ ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا ۖ وَٱلْبَـٰقِيَـٰتُ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتُ خَيْرٌ عِندَ رَبِّكَ ثَوَابًۭا وَخَيْرٌ أَمَلًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Wealth	and	sons	are	ornaments	of	the	life	
of	 this	 world;	 and	 good	 deeds	 that	 last	-
their	 reward	 is	 better	 before	 your	 Lord,	
and	are	better	in	respect	of	hope.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Māl	 aur	 bete	 yeh	 jeeti	 duniya	 ka	 singār	
(zeenat)	 hai	 aur	 bāqi	 rahne	 wāli	 achchi	
bāteiñ	un	ka	sawāb	tumhāre	Rab	ke	yahañ	
behtar	aur	woh	ummid	meiñ	sab	se	bhali.

arabicText: وَيَوْمَ نُسَيِّرُ ٱلْجِبَالَ وَتَرَى ٱلْأَرْضَ بَارِزَةًۭ وَحَشَرْنَـٰهُمْ فَلَمْ نُغَادِرْ مِنْهُمْ أَحَدًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	the	Day	when	We	move	the	hills	and	
you	see	 the	earth	 flattened	plain,	and	We	
shall	 raise	 all	 of	 them	 together	 - so	 not	
leaving	out	any	one	of	them.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 jis	 din	 ham	 pahadoñ	 ko	 chalāyeñ	 ge	
aur	tum	zameen	ko	sāf	khuli	huwi	dekhoge	
aur	 ham	 unheñ	 uthayeñ	 ge	 to	 unmeiñ	 se	
kisi	ko	chhod	na	deñge

arabicText: وَعُرِضُوا۟ عَلَىٰ رَبِّكَ صَفًّۭا لَّقَدْ جِئْتُمُونَا كَمَا خَلَقْنَـٰكُمْ أَوَّلَ مَرَّةٍۭ ۚ بَلْ زَعَمْتُمْ أَلَّن نَّجْعَلَ لَكُم مَّوْعِدًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	 everyone	 shall	 be	 presented	 before	
your	 Lord	 in	 rows;	 “Indeed	 you	 have	
come	to	Us	exactly	as	We	had	created	you	
for	the	first	time	- in	fact	you	thought	that	
We	 shall	 never	 appoint	 a	 promised	 time	
for	you!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 sab	 tumhāre	 Rab	 ke	 huzoor	 parā	
bāñdhe	(safe	banāye)	pesh	hoñge	be	shak	
tum	hamare	pās	waise	hi	āaye	jaisā	ham	ne	
tumhe	pehli	bār	banāyā	thā	balke	tumhara	
gumān	thā	ke	ham	hargiz	tumhāre	liye	koi	
w’ade	ka	waqt	na	rakheñ	ge

arabicText: وَوُضِعَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبُ فَتَرَى ٱلْمُجْرِمِينَ مُشْفِقِينَ مِمَّا فِيهِ وَيَقُولُونَ يَـٰوَيْلَتَنَا مَالِ هَـٰذَا ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ لَا يُغَادِرُ صَغِيرَةًۭ وَلَا كَبِيرَةً إِلَّآ أَحْصَىٰهَا ۚ وَوَجَدُوا۟ مَا عَمِلُوا۟ حَاضِرًۭا ۗ وَلَا يَظْلِمُ رَبُّكَ أَحَدًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	 the	 Book	 shall	 be	 placed	 - and	 you	
will	 see	 the	 guilty	 dreading	 what	 is	
written	in	it	and	saying,	“Woe	to	us	- what	
sort	of	a	Book	is	this	that	it	has	not	left	out	
any	small	sin	nor	a	great	one,	which	it	has	
not	 included!”	 And	 they	 found	 all	 that	
they	did	confronting	them;	and	your	Lord	
does	not	wrong	any	one.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 Namā-e-Āmāl rakha	 jāye	 ga	 to	 tum	
mujrimoñ	 ko	 dekhoge	 ke	 us	 ke	 likhe	 se	
darte	 hoñge	 aur	 kaheñ	 ge	 hāye	 kharabi	
hamari	is	nawishta	(tehreer)	ko	kiya	huwa	
na	is	ne	 koi	 chota	gunāh	 chhoda	na	 badā	
jise	gher	liyā	ho	aur	apnā	sab	kiya	unho	ne	
sāmne	pāya	aur	tumhāra	Rab	kisi	par	ẓulm	
nahiñ	karta

arabicText: وَإِذْ قُلْنَا لِلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةِ ٱسْجُدُوا۟ لِـَٔادَمَ فَسَجَدُوٓا۟ إِلَّآ إِبْلِيسَ كَانَ مِنَ ٱلْجِنِّ فَفَسَقَ عَنْ أَمْرِ رَبِّهِۦٓ ۗ أَفَتَتَّخِذُونَهُۥ وَذُرِّيَّتَهُۥٓ أَوْلِيَآءَ مِن دُونِى وَهُمْ لَكُمْ عَدُوٌّۢ ۚ بِئْسَ لِلظَّـٰلِمِينَ بَدَلًۭا
englishTranslationText:
. And	 recall	 when	 We	 commanded	 the	
angels	 that,	 “Prostrate	 before	Adam”	- so	
they	all	prostrated,	except	Iblis;	he	was	of	
the	jinn,	he	 therefore	rebelled	against	his	
Lord’s	command;	 “What!	You	choose	him	
and	 his	 offspring	 as	 your	 friends	 instead	
of	 Me,	 whereas	 they	 are	 your	 enemies?”	
And	what	an	evil	alternative	did	the	unjust	get.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 yād	 karo	 jab	 ham	 ne	 farishtoñ	 ko	
farmaya	ke	ādam	ko	sajda	karo	 to	sab	ne	
sajda	kiya	siwa	iblis	ke	Qoum-e-Jinn	se	tha	
to	 apne	 Rab	 ke	 ḥukmse	 nikal	 gayā	 bhala	
kya	use	 or uski	awlād	 ko	mere	 siwa	dost	
banāte	 ho?	 Aur	 woh	 tumhāre	 dushman	
haiñ	ẓālimoñ	ko	kya	hi	bura	badal	(badla)	
milā

arabicText: ۞ مَّآ أَشْهَدتُّهُمْ خَلْقَ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَلَا خَلْقَ أَنفُسِهِمْ وَمَا كُنتُ مُتَّخِذَ ٱلْمُضِلِّينَ عَضُدًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Neither	did	I	make	them	witness	the	creations	of	the	heavens	and	the	earth,	nor	witness	their	
own	creation;	nor	does	it	befit	My	Majesty	to	choose	misleaders	as	aides.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Na	maiñ	ne	āasmānoñ	aur	zameen	ko	banāte	waqt	unheñ	sāmne	baitha	liyā	tha	na	khud	unke	
banāte	waqt	aur	na	meri	shān	ke	gumrāh	karne	wāloñ	ko	bāzo	banāoñ

arabicText: وَيَوْمَ يَقُولُ نَادُوا۟ شُرَكَآءِىَ ٱلَّذِينَ زَعَمْتُمْ فَدَعَوْهُمْ فَلَمْ يَسْتَجِيبُوا۟ لَهُمْ وَجَعَلْنَا بَيْنَهُم مَّوْبِقًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	the	Day	when	He	will	proclaim,	“Call	those	partners	of	Mine	whom	you	had	assumed”	- so	
they	will	call	out	to	them	- they	will	not	answer	them,	and	We	shall	create	a	field	of	destruction	
between	them.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jis	din	farmāye	ga	ke	pukāro	mere	sharikoñ	ko	jo	tum	gumān	karte	the	to	unheñ	pukāreñ	ge	
jawāb	na	deñ	ge	aur	ham	un	ke	darmiyāñ	ek	halākat	ka	maidān	kar	deñge

arabicText: وَرَءَا ٱلْمُجْرِمُونَ ٱلنَّارَ فَظَنُّوٓا۟ أَنَّهُم مُّوَاقِعُوهَا وَلَمْ يَجِدُوا۟ عَنْهَا مَصْرِفًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	 when	 the	 guilty	 see	 hell,	 they	 will	 be	 certain	 of	 falling	 into	 it,	 and	 will	 find	 no	 place	 to	
escape	from	it.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	mujrim	dozakh	ko	dekheñge	to	yaqeen	kareñ	ge	ke	unheñ	is	me	girna	hai	aur	us	se phirne	ki	
koi	jagah	na	pāyeñ	ge

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ صَرَّفْنَا فِى هَـٰذَا ٱلْقُرْءَانِ لِلنَّاسِ مِن كُلِّ مَثَلٍۢ ۚ وَكَانَ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنُ أَكْثَرَ شَىْءٍۢ جَدَلًۭا
romanUrduTranslationText:
.Aur	be-shak	ham	ne	logoñ	ke	liye	is	Qurān	
meiñ	 har	 qism	 ki	 maṣal	 (miṣāleñ)	 tarah	
tarah	bayān	 farmāyiñ	aur	ādmi	har	cheez	
se	badh	kar	jhagdhālu	hai

arabicText: وَمَا مَنَعَ ٱلنَّاسَ أَن يُؤْمِنُوٓا۟ إِذْ جَآءَهُمُ ٱلْهُدَىٰ وَيَسْتَغْفِرُوا۟ رَبَّهُمْ إِلَّآ أَن تَأْتِيَهُمْ سُنَّةُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ أَوْ يَأْتِيَهُمُ ٱلْعَذَابُ قُبُلًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	what	 prevented	men	 from	accepting	
faith	 when	 guidance	 came	 to	 them,	 and	
from	 asking	 forgiveness	 from	 their	 Lord	
except	 that	 the	 tradition	 of	 the	 former	
nations	 come	 upon	 them	 or	 that	 they	
confront	various	kinds	of	punishments?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	ādmiyoñ	 ko	 kis	 chiz	 ne	is	 se	 rokā	 ke	
Imān lāte	 jab	 hidāyat	 un	 ke	 pās	 āyi	 aur	
apne	Rab	se	m'uāfi	māñgte	magar	yeh	ke	
un	 par	 agloñ	 ka	 dastoor	 āaye	 yā	 un	 par	
qisam	qisam	ka		áƶāb	āaye

arabicText: وَمَا نُرْسِلُ ٱلْمُرْسَلِينَ إِلَّا مُبَشِّرِينَ وَمُنذِرِينَ ۚ وَيُجَـٰدِلُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ بِٱلْبَـٰطِلِ لِيُدْحِضُوا۟ بِهِ ٱلْحَقَّ ۖ وَٱتَّخَذُوٓا۟ ءَايَـٰتِى وَمَآ أُنذِرُوا۟ هُزُوًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	 We	 do	 not	 send	 the	 Noble	
Messengers	 except	 as	 Heralds	 of	 glad	
tidings	 and	 warnings;	 and	 the	
disbelievers	debate	by	means	of	falsehood	
to	drive	away	 the	Truth	with	it,	and	 they	
took	 My	 signs	 and	 warnings	 they	 were	
given,	as	a	mockery!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	ham	Rasooloñ	ko	nahiñ	bhejte	magar	
khushi	 aur	 dar	 sunāne	 wāle	 aur	 jo	 kāfir	
haiñ	woh	bāṭil	ke	sāth	jhagadte	haiñ	ke	us	
se	 haq	 ko	 hatāyeñ	 aur	 unhoñ	 ne	 meri	
Āyatoñ	ki	aur	jo	dar	unheñ	sunāye	gaye	the	
un	ki	hañsi	banāli

arabicText: وَمَنْ أَظْلَمُ مِمَّن ذُكِّرَ بِـَٔايَـٰتِ رَبِّهِۦ فَأَعْرَضَ عَنْهَا وَنَسِىَ مَا قَدَّمَتْ يَدَاهُ ۚ إِنَّا جَعَلْنَا عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِمْ أَكِنَّةً أَن يَفْقَهُوهُ وَفِىٓ ءَاذَانِهِمْ وَقْرًۭا ۖ وَإِن تَدْعُهُمْ إِلَى ٱلْهُدَىٰ فَلَن يَهْتَدُوٓا۟ إِذًا أَبَدًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	 who	 is	 more	 unjust	 than	 one	 who,	
when reminded	 of	 the	 signs	 of	 his	 Lord,	
turns	 away	 from	 them	 and	 forgets	 what	
his	hands	have	sent	forward?	We	have	put	
covers	 on	 their	 hearts	 so	 as	 not	 to	
understand	 the	 Qur’an,	 and	 deafness	 in	
their	 ears;	 and	 even	 if	 you	 call	 them	 to	
guidance,	 they	will	 never attain	 the	 right	
path.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 us	 se	 badh	 kar	 ẓālim	 kaun	jise	 us	 ke	
Rab	ki	āyateñ	yād	dilāyi	jāyeñ	to	woh	un	se	
muñh		 pher	le	aur	us	ke	hath	jo	āage	bhej	
chuke	usey	bhool	jāye	ham	ne	un	ke	diloñ	
par	 gilāf	 	 kar	 diye	 haiñ	 ke	 qurān	 na	
samjheñ	aur	un	ke	kānoñ	meiñ	girāni	(aqs)	
aur	agar	tum	unheñ	hidāyat	ki	taraf	bulāo	
to	jab	bhi	har	giz	kabhi	rāh	na	pāyeñ	ge

arabicText: وَرَبُّكَ ٱلْغَفُورُ ذُو ٱلرَّحْمَةِ ۖ لَوْ يُؤَاخِذُهُم بِمَا كَسَبُوا۟ لَعَجَّلَ لَهُمُ ٱلْعَذَابَ ۚ بَل لَّهُم مَّوْعِدٌۭ لَّن يَجِدُوا۟ مِن دُونِهِۦ مَوْئِلًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	 your	 Lord	 is	 the	 Oft	 Forgiver,	 the	
Merciful;	 if	 He	 seized	 them	 for	 their	
deeds,	 He	 would	 soon	 send	 the	
punishment	upon	 them;	but	 for	 them	is	an	appointed	 time	 from	which	 they	will	not	 find	any	
refuge.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 tumhāra	 Rab	 bakhsh	 ne	 wāla	 maher	
(raḥmat)	wāla	hai	agar	woh	unheñ	un	ke	
kiye	par	pakadta	to	jald	un	par	‘aƶāb	bhejta	
balke	un	ke	liye	ek	w’adah	ka	waqt	hai	jis	
ke	sāmne	koi	panah	na	pāyeñ	ge.

arabicText: وَتِلْكَ ٱلْقُرَىٰٓ أَهْلَكْنَـٰهُمْ لَمَّا ظَلَمُوا۟ وَجَعَلْنَا لِمَهْلِكِهِم مَّوْعِدًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	 these	 towns	 - We	 destroyed	 them	 when	 they	 committed	 injustice,	 and	 We	 had	 set	 an	
appointed	time	for	their	destruction.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	yeh	bastiyāñ	ham	ne	tabāh	kar	diñ!	Jab	unhoñ	me	ẓulm	kiya	aur	ham	ne	un	ki	barbādi	ka	ek	
w’āda	rakha	tha.

arabicText: وَإِذْ قَالَ مُوسَىٰ لِفَتَىٰهُ لَآ أَبْرَحُ حَتَّىٰٓ أَبْلُغَ مَجْمَعَ ٱلْبَحْرَيْنِ أَوْ أَمْضِىَ حُقُبًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	recall	when	Moosa	said	to	his	assistant,	“I	will	not	give	up	until	I	reach	the	place	where	the	
two	seas	meet	or	until	I	have	progressed	for	ages.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
aur	 yād	 karo	 jab	 Mūsā ne	 apne	 khādim	 se	 kahā	 maiñ	 b’az	 na	 rahuñ	 ga	 jab	 tak	 wahāñ	 na	
pahuñchooñ	jahāñ	do	samandar	mile	haiñ	yā	qarnoñ	chalā	(madtoñ	chalta)	jāuñ

arabicText: فَلَمَّا بَلَغَا مَجْمَعَ بَيْنِهِمَا نَسِيَا حُوتَهُمَا فَٱتَّخَذَ سَبِيلَهُۥ فِى ٱلْبَحْرِ سَرَبًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	when	they	reached	the	place	where	the	two	seas	meet,	they	forgot	about	their	fish,	and	it	
took	its	way	into	the	sea,	making	a	tunnel.	(The dead fish came alive and went into the water.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	jab	woh	donoñ	un	me	daryāoñ	ke	milne	ki	jagah	pahuñche	apni	machchli	bhool	gaye	aur	us	
ne	samandar	meiñ	apni	rāh	li	surang	banāti	phir	jab	wahañ	se	guzar	gaye

arabicText: فَلَمَّا جَاوَزَا قَالَ لِفَتَىٰهُ ءَاتِنَا غَدَآءَنَا لَقَدْ لَقِينَا مِن سَفَرِنَا هَـٰذَا نَصَبًۭا
englishTranslationText:
So	when	they	had	gone	beyond	that	place,	
Moosa	 said	 to	 his	 assistant,	 “Bring	 our	
breakfast	 - we	 have	 indeed	 faced	 great	
exertion	in	this	journey	of	ours.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
.Mūsā ne	khādim	se	kahā	hamara	subah	ka	
khāna	 lāo	 be-shak	 hameiñ	 apne	 is	 safar	
meiñ	badi	mashaqqat	ka	sāmna	huwa

arabicText: قَالَ أَرَءَيْتَ إِذْ أَوَيْنَآ إِلَى ٱلصَّخْرَةِ فَإِنِّى نَسِيتُ ٱلْحُوتَ وَمَآ أَنسَىٰنِيهُ إِلَّا ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنُ أَنْ أَذْكُرَهُۥ ۚ وَٱتَّخَذَ سَبِيلَهُۥ فِى ٱلْبَحْرِ عَجَبًۭا
englishTranslationText:
He	 said,	 “Just	 imagine	 - when	 we	 had	
taken	 shelter	 near	 the	 rock,	 so	 indeed	 I	
forgot	the	fish;	and none	but	Satan	caused	
me	 to	 forget	 to	 mention	 it;	 and	 the	 fish	
took	its	way	into	the	sea	- its	amazing!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bolā	 bhala	 dekhiye	 to	 jab	 ham	 ne	 us	
chattān	ke	pās	jagah	li	thi	to	be-shak		maiñ	
machhli	ko	bhool	gayā	aur	mujhe	shaiṭān	
hi	 ne	 bhula	 diyā	 ke	 maiñ	 us	 ka	 mazkoor	
(zikr)	 karuñ	aur	us	ne	 to	 samandar	meiñ	
apni	rāh	li	achamba	(ajeeb	baat)	hai

arabicText: قَالَ ذَٰلِكَ مَا كُنَّا نَبْغِ ۚ فَٱرْتَدَّا عَلَىٰٓ ءَاثَارِهِمَا قَصَصًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Said	 Moosa,	 “This	 is	 exactly	 what	 we	
wanted”;	 so	 they	 came	 back	 retracing	
their	steps.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Mūsā ne	 kahā	 yahi	 to	 ham	 chahte	 the	 to	
piche	palte	apne	qadmoñ	ke	nishān	dekhte

arabicText: فَوَجَدَا عَبْدًۭا مِّنْ عِبَادِنَآ ءَاتَيْنَـٰهُ رَحْمَةًۭ مِّنْ عِندِنَا وَعَلَّمْنَـٰهُ مِن لَّدُنَّا عِلْمًۭا
englishTranslationText:
So	they	found	a	bondman	*	from	amongst	
Our	(chosen)	bondmen,	to	whom	We	 had	
given	 mercy	 from	 Us,	 and	 had	 bestowed	
the	inspired	knowledge	from	Ourselves.	(*	
Hazrat	Khidr	- peace	be	upon	him.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	hamāre	bandoñ	meiñ	se	ek	banda	pāya	
jise	ham	ne	apne	pās	se	raḥmat	di	aur	use	
apna	Ílm-e- ladunni	‘aṭā	kiya

arabicText: قَالَ لَهُۥ مُوسَىٰ هَلْ أَتَّبِعُكَ عَلَىٰٓ أَن تُعَلِّمَنِ مِمَّا عُلِّمْتَ رُشْدًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Moosa	 said	 to	 him,	 “May	 I	 stay	 with	 you	
upon	the	condition	that	you	will	teach	me	
the	 righteousness	 that	 you	 have	 been	
taught?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
us	se	Mūsā ne	kaha	kya	meiñ tumhāre	sāth	
rahuñ	is	sharṭ par	ke	tum	mujhe	sikha	do	
ge	nek	bāt	jo	tumheiñ	t'alim	huwi?

arabicText: قَالَ إِنَّكَ لَن تَسْتَطِيعَ مَعِىَ صَبْرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
He	 said,	 “You	 will	 never	 be	 able	 to	
patiently	stay	with	me.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kahā	āap	mere	sāth	hargiz	na	thaher	sakeñ	
ge

arabicText: وَكَيْفَ تَصْبِرُ عَلَىٰ مَا لَمْ تُحِطْ بِهِۦ خُبْرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
“And	how	will	you	bear	something	which	
your	knowledge	does	not	encompass?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	us	bāt	par	kyuñ	kar	sabr	kareñ	ge	jise	
āap	ka	ilm	muheet	nahiñ

arabicText: قَالَ سَتَجِدُنِىٓ إِن شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ صَابِرًۭا وَلَآ أَعْصِى لَكَ أَمْرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Said	 Moosa,	 “Allah willing,	 you	 will	 soon	
find	me	patient	and	I	will	not	do	anything	
against	your	instructions.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kya	 an	 kareeb	Allah	 chahe	 to	 tum	mujhe	
sābir	pāoge	aur	maiñ	tumhāre	kisi	ḥukmke	
khilāf	na	karuñ	ga.

arabicText: قَالَ فَإِنِ ٱتَّبَعْتَنِى فَلَا تَسْـَٔلْنِى عَن شَىْءٍ حَتَّىٰٓ أُحْدِثَ لَكَ مِنْهُ ذِكْرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
He	said,	“Therefore	if	you	stay	with	me,	do	not	ask	me	about	anything	until	I	myself	mention	it	
to	you.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kahā	to	agar	āap	mere	sāth	rehte	haiñ	to	mujh	se	kisi	bāt	ko	na	puñchhna	jab	tak	maiñ	khud	is	ka	
ƶikr	na	karuñ

arabicText: فَٱنطَلَقَا حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا رَكِبَا فِى ٱلسَّفِينَةِ خَرَقَهَا ۖ قَالَ أَخَرَقْتَهَا لِتُغْرِقَ أَهْلَهَا لَقَدْ جِئْتَ شَيْـًٔا إِمْرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
So	they	both	set	out;	until	when	they	had	boarded	the	boat,	the	chosen	bondman	ruptured	the	
boat;	said	Moosa,	“Did	you	make	a	hole	in	the	boat	in	order	to	drown	its	passengers?	You	have	
indeed	done	an	evil	thing.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ab	donoñ	chale	yahañ	tak	ke	jab	kashti	meiñ	sawār	huwe	us	bande	ne	usey	chir	dāla	Mūsā ne	
kaha	kya	tum	ne	isey	is	liye	chira	ke	is	ke	sawaloñ	ko	dubā	do	be-shak		yeh	tum	ne	buri	bāt	ki

arabicText: قَالَ أَلَمْ أَقُلْ إِنَّكَ لَن تَسْتَطِيعَ مَعِىَ صَبْرًۭا
englishTranslationText: He	said,	“Did	I	not	say	that	you	will	never	be	able	to	patiently stay	with	me?”
romanUrduTranslationText: Kaha	maiñ	na	kahta	tha	ke	āap	mere	sāth	hargiz	na	thaher	sakeñ	ge

arabicText: قَالَ لَا تُؤَاخِذْنِى بِمَا نَسِيتُ وَلَا تُرْهِقْنِى مِنْ أَمْرِى عُسْرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Said	Moosa,	“Do	not	apprehend	me	upon	my	 forgetting,	and	do	not	impose	difficulty	on	me	in	
my	task.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Kaha	mujh	se	meri	bhool	par	giraft	na	karo	aur	mujh	par	mere	kām	meiñ	mushkil	na	dālo.

arabicText: فَٱنطَلَقَا حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا لَقِيَا غُلَـٰمًۭا فَقَتَلَهُۥ قَالَ أَقَتَلْتَ نَفْسًۭا زَكِيَّةًۢ بِغَيْرِ نَفْسٍۢ لَّقَدْ جِئْتَ شَيْـًۭٔا نُّكْرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
So	they	set	out	again;	until	when	they	met	a	boy,	the	chosen	bondman	slew	him	- Moosa	said,	
“Did	 you	 slay	 an	 innocent	 soul	 not	 in	 retribution	 for	 another?	 You	 have	 indeed	 done	 an	
extremely	evil	thing.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	donoñ	chale	yahañ	tak	ke	jab	ek	ladka	mila	us	bande	ne	usey	qatl	kar	diya	Moosa	ne	kaha	
kya	tum	ne	ek	suthri	jān	be	kisi	jān	ke	badle	qatl	kar	di	be-shak		tum	ne	bahut	buri	bāt	ki.
